name: ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Bored Pile
template name: ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Bored Pile

name: Detail - Contractor to set out grid lines as per contract drawings and specification.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Construction Drawing
Detail - Any services in the area are to be clearly marked before any work commence.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Survey
Conformance Criteria - Service location conducted by asset owner, marked out with dazzle on site.

Detail - On completion of the set out of the wall, the Contractor shall immediately advise the Engineer for the purposes of checking the set out. No other works shall be carried out until this has been checked and approved by the Engineer
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Survey
Conformance Criteria - If the set out is found to be incorrect, the works shall again be set out by the Contractor and re- checked by the Engineer.
Detail - Timber post spacing and clearance to be in line with the drawing specifications. Set out should allow for clearance, angle and spacing of centres
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
○ 100mm of clearance on all sides of pile
○ 100mm minimum cover of concrete at base.
Detail - Minimum Pole embedment to be as outlined in specifications
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Pole minimum embedment to be be 3.25m, unless otherwise stated in the pole schedule on drawing C013
Records - Photos, log, site inspection, ConQA

Detail - The timber poles are to be radiata pine, high density selected in accordance with and complying with NZS 3605:2001 for cross-section, length, straightness, strength and branding. All materials used in the works shall be new unless otherwise specified.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - The Engineer shall be provided with a certificate of compliance
Detail - The poles must be H5 treated in accordance with NZS 3640, H5.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - The Engineer shall be provided with a certificate of compliance that the poles have all been treated to NZS 3640, H5.

Detail - Poles are to be peeled and not machine shaved and not steam treated. All cut ends, notches or drill holes shall be treated with a liberal brush coat of copper naphthenate or equivalent wood preservative before sealing with a bituminous sealer. Cut ends shall not be in contact with soil.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Engineer to inspect as accordance with specifications
Detail - Concrete mix design(s) shall be submitted to the Engineer in writing prior to placing concrete and approved before placing concrete.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Engineer to approve design prior to commencement
Detail - All concrete delivered to site shall be produced strictly in accordance with the approved mix design
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Concrete Delivery Dockets
Conformance Criteria - Site engineer to inspect delivery dockets
Detail - The concrete used to backfill around the timber poles must have a minimum 28-day compressive strength of 20MPa. Concrete batch crush test supplied by concrete supplier for 28 days.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Records - Test Reports, Lab Testing Register
Detail - Check if the bench the has been excavated/filled can accommodate the entire pile line
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Site engineer to inspect against relevant drawings
Detail - Drilling is to be carried out for every second pole, and poles shall be placed and concreted for at least 24 hours before any drilling for intermediate holes
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - CPS engineer to inspect
Detail - Check drilling performance, verticality and position using equipment of sufficient capacity for the ground conditions.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Site supervisor to inspect
Detail - Timber poles are installed in pre-drilled holes to the dimensions and at the locations and batters shown on the drawings,
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - CPS engineer to inspect, inspect as accordance with specifications
Detail - Inspect pile bore condition, pile depth, rock socket length and toe level
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - CPS engineer to inspect, inspect as accordance with specifications

Detail - The Contractor shall maintain a log describing the type of soil and rock, the ground water level and the general ground conditions encountered in each hole excavation; hole location, reference number, and total depth of hole below ground level.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Information shall be provided to the Engineer at the end of each day's work.

Detail - The chosen method of excavation shall minimise overbreak and prevent collapse of ground outside the hole excavation. All loose material is to be removed from the base of the hole before post installation and concreting
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review -  visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Areas of overbreak are to be reinstated in an approved manner
Detail - The contactor must minimise the impact that the drilling has on the environment.All material collected from the drilling process will need to be removed from the site.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - All drilling must be in line with the EMP and other environmental protection documents
Records - Monitor, review document with Environmental team
Detail - Check that holes are not to be left open overnight.
Frequency - Close of works each day
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review -  visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Site supervisor to check at close of works each day
Detail - The Contractor shall inform the Engineer for an inspection of the excavation by a suitably qualified geotechnical professional
Frequency - Completion of stage or bore drilling
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Contractor to notify engineer, Geotechnical Engineer to attend and approve excavation
Detail - The hole must be excavated to the tolerances outlined in the specifications
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
○ Hole plan position at all depths +/- 20mm
○ The pole shall not vary any more than 2 degrees from 20 degrees
Detail - Timber poles shall then be set into the holes, complying with the tolerances outlined in the specifications
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Deviation of pole centre from line in plan +/- 10mm
Detail - Ensure the Permit to Concrete Pump & Pump Operator Checksheet has been completed before concrete pumping commences
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Site Engineer to compete CP and PO checksheets
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - A pre pour inspection checksheet to be completed outlining:
– Pre pour inspection checksheet to be completed
Detail - Concrete dockets checked for correct mix and concrete site testing undertaken. Dockets to the Engineer and keep a record of the volume of concrete placed.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Test Results
Conformance Criteria - NZS 3104 Concrete dockets match design
Detail - The concrete in each hole shall be completed as one continuous operation
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Records - Photos, log, site inspection, Document
Detail - Securing of poles in position, then the approved concrete mix shall be poured around the timber pole with concrete being tremmied if required
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Records - Photos, log, site inspection, Document
Detail - Check concrete placement method and finish
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection, Document Review
Detail - Survey final position and R.L. of each pile, produce As-Built drawings
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Measurement / Survey
Detail - Ensure all NCRs are closed and included within QA file, Delivery Dockets and Lab Testing Spreadsheet and Test Reports to be included in QA File
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all QA is uploaded into ConQA / Procore
Records - Delivery Dockets, Test Reports, Lab Testing Register
Detail - Check all piling records are completed and signed by the relevant signatory.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Detail - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - At the completion of the Lot of work
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Drawings
ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Ground Anchor
template name: ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Ground Anchor

name: Detail - Location of the tests (to be agreed with the Engineer, two tests shall be completed), and 1 pull test location.
Frequency - At least 1 week prior to Testing
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Construction Drawing and agreed with Engineer
Detail - Any services in the area are to be clearly marked before any work commence.
Frequency - At least 1 week prior to Testing
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Service location
Conformance Criteria - Service location conducted by asset owner, marked out with dazzle on site.
Records - Asset owner report, site inspection
○ Anchor rod diameter: minimum 25mm threaded bar, with a minimum yield strength of 500 Mpa
Frequency - At least 1 week prior to Testing
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Design Working Load (DWL) per Anchor: 168kN
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition

Detail - The steel structural sections for the Waler assemblies shall be primed with ethyl silicate or alkali silicate zinc rich primer in accordance with AS/NZS 4680, ASNZS 2312 Part 1 Paint Coatings and NZTA S9 respectively.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - AS/NZS 3679.1, AS/NZS 4680, ASNZS 2312 Part 1
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition

Detail - The Contractor shall provide the engineer with test certificates giving the tensile and yield strengths of the steel used to manufacture the structural steels and steel plates at least seven days prior to the fabrication of waler.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Test certificates of tensile and yield strengths, 7 days prior to installation, 150 mm x 75 mm PFC WALER BEAM
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - 150 mm x 75 mm PFC WALER BEAM
Detail - Bearing plates shall be steel with a minimum yield strength of 350MPa and the final size and thickness shall be confirmed by the Contractor in conjunction with the anchor supplier.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - minimum yield strength of 350MPa
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
9 - Hex nut/ Washer Plate Material Compliance
Detail - Shall be standard, heavy-duty, high strength, structural quality only, flat base, machined from steel, designed for use with the all-threaded anchor rod.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - conforming to Grade AS/NZS 1252
○ Develop more than 125% of the yield strength of the anchor rod & ultimate strength of not less than 100% of the guaranteed ultimate tensile strength
○ Hex nut/washer shall be hot dipped galvanised.
Detail - Mechanical couplings, when required, may be used to splice the anchors.
○ The couplings shall be stainless steel and wrapped in Denso Tape to satisfy double corrosion protection requirements.
○ Grub screws or locknuts shall be installed and mechanically tightened either side of the mechanical couple
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, Inspection
Conformance Criteria - 100% of the guaranteed ultimate tensile strength of the anchor rod
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition
Detail - The Contractor shall submit a construction plan and detailed construction sequence to the Engineer at least 1 week to commencing pull-out testing
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Document outlining Start date, working drawings, methods, manufacturer certificates, detailed construction sequence
Detail - The contractor needs to supply working drawings which outline the details and location of the pull out tests
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
○ Location of the tests (approved by CPS)
13 - Anchor Construction Submittals - Ground Anchor Schedule
Detail - The contractor needs to supply a ground anchor schedule which outlines the strength and detailing requirements:
○ Ground anchor capacity reduction factors for rod & pull-out
○ Type and size of anchor rod;
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Anchor submittal Document outlining strength and detailing meets specification
Detail - Details of the jacking frame and appurtenant bracing.
○ Identification number and certified calibration records for each test jack and pressure gauge and
○ load cell to be used. Calibration records to include the date tested, device identification number, and the calibration test results and shall be
○ conducted by a qualified independent testing laboratory within forty-five (45) working days prior to submittal
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Anchor submittal Document outlining strength and detailing meets specification
○ Certified for an accuracy of at least 2 percent of the applied certification loads

Detail - Testing equipment shall include dial gauges, dial gauge support, jack and pressure gauge, electronic load cell, and a reaction frame. Contractor shall provide the description to the Engineer prior to testing.
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - description of test setup and jack, pressure gauge and load cell calibration curves
Detail - The testing reaction frame shall be sufficiently rigid and of adequate dimensions such that excessive deformation of the testing equipment does not occur.
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Reaction frame sufficiently rigid
○ Support and centre jackover anchor rod
○ Jack, bearing plates and stressing anchorage aligned with rod to as not require repositioning during test
Records - Anchor Test log, photos, submittal doc

Detail - Test load shall use hydraulic jack and pressure gauge. The pressure gauge shall be graduated in 500 kPa increments or less. The jack and pressure gauge shall have a pressure range not exceeding twice the anticipated maximum test pressure.
○ Monitor the anchor load during the pull-out test with both the pressure gauge and the load cell. Use the load cell to maintain constant load during the creep test portion of the pull-out test.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, visual inspections
Conformance Criteria - Jack and pressure gauge shall have a pressure range within requirements
Records - Anchor testing submittal, Anchor testing log
Detail - Measure the anchor head movement with a dial gauge capable of measuring to 0.025 mm. Use two dial gauges when the test setup requires reaction against a soil cut face.
Conformance Criteria - Gauge capable of 0.025mm used
○ Visually aligned gauge parallel with axis of anchor
○ Two gauges used during reaction against a soil cut face
Records - Visual inspection, photos, Anchor testing log
19 - Anchor Construction Submittals - Ground anchor report

Detail - As-built drawings showing the location and orientation of each ground anchor, anchor capacity, total anchor length as installed. Ground anchor test results, graphs and supporting interpretation
Frequency - within twenty (20) calendar days after completing installation
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Ground anchor report sent to engineer within twenty (20) calendar days containing:
Detail - store steel and accessories without damage or contamination. All materials shall be stored on timber pallets on hard ground in a secure area, clear of any construction operations.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - inspection
Conformance Criteria - Stored on timber pallets
Detail - Anchor components incorporated in the wall shall be free of corrosion and physical damage at the time of placement
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - inspection
Conformance Criteria - Free of corrosion and physical damage, Placed so will not damage ground

Detail - Works shall be carried out in accordance with NZGS (2023) Ground Anchors: Design and Construction Guideline. Should any discrepancies between the relevant codes and standards contained in the above Guideline and this Specification arise, they shall be brought to the attention of the Engineer
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - inspection
Conformance Criteria - NZGS (2023) Ground Anchors: Design and Construction Guideline
Detail - Anchors shall be installed at an angle within ±2 degrees of the angle of the theoretical centreline and shall be located horizontally on the face of the wall accurately
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Angle within ±2 degrees of the angle of the theoretical centreline plus or minus 25 mm from the position shown on the drawings.

Detail - No-load greater than 10% of the design load can be applied to the ground anchor prior to testing. The maximum test load shall not exceed 80% of the specified minimum ultimate tensile strength of the anchor rod.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual inspection,
Conformance Criteria - Pull-Out Test Schedule <80% min ULT load
Detail - Pull-out testing shall be carried out on one sacrificial ground anchor, The pull-out test shall be done at a location and elevation agreed and approved by the Engineer.
Frequency - Prior to installation of anchors
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Conducted prior to installation, Location approved by CPS Engineer
Records - Pull out test log, Submittal

Detail - The pull-out test shall be carried out to 150% of the Design Working Load (DWL) and the contractor shall supply a larger anchor rod (if required) to safely accommodate the maximum test load. Anchor movements during the Creep Test shall be measured and recorded.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Refer to the Pull out test schedule
○ Maintained within 2% of the intended load
Detail - The alignment load (AL) should not exceed 5% of the DWL. Dial gauges should be set to zero after the alignment load has been applied.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - AL not exceed 5% of the DWL
Detail - The results of the pull-out test, along with calculations and their interpretation shall be forwarded to the Engineer
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Engineer to send through approval within 48 hours of receiving results
30 - Ground Anchors - Proof Testing of Anchors
Detail - The proof tests shall incrementally load each ground anchor in accordance with the Proof Test Loading Schedule and in conjunction with the specifications 5.7.3.3
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Proof testing completed on two anchors as selected by the Engineer

Detail - The maximum test load in a proof test shall maintain a constant load. The load-hold period shall start as soon as the maximum test load is applied and the ground anchor movement with respect to a fixed reference shall be measured
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - recorded at 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 10 minutes. If creep test up to 10 minutes exceeds 1 mm, the maximum test load shall be held for an additional 50 minutes
Detail - The remaining anchors should also be tested to the same methodology up to 1.00 of the DWL unless approved otherwise by the Engineer.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Total movement within the 10 minute hold is less than 1 mm between 1 and 10 minutes.
Detail - Survey final position and R.L. of each anchor, produce As-Built drawings
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Measurement / Survey
Detail - Ensure all NCRs are closed and included within QA file, Delivery Dockets and Lab Testing Spreadsheet and Test Reports to be included in QA File
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all QA is uploaded into ConQA / Procore
Records - Delivery Dockets, Test Reports, Lab Testing Register
Detail - Check all anchor records are completed and signed by the relevant signatory.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Detail - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - At the completion of the Lot of work
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Drawings
ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Retaining Wall & Backfill
template name: ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Retaining Wall & Backfill

name: Detail - Contractor to set out grid lines as per contract drawings and specification.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Construction Drawing
Detail - The lagging must be radiata pine planks of normal density, All.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - The Engineer shall be provided with a certificate of compliance:
○ H4 treated in accordance with NZS 3640, H4
○ Cut ends or notches shall be treated with a liberal brush coat of copper naphthenate or equivalent wood preservative
Detail - Each section of lagging shall span a minimum of three poles.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Inspect and document span of lagging
Detail - The granular aggregates for use behind the wall shall be open course graded clean washed durable aggregate
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Crushing resistance of not less than 100kN when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991
○ Be crushed aggregate with a min. 50% broken faces (NZS 4407 Test 3.14);
○ Free of organic and other deleterious material; and
○ Meet the particle size grading envelope outlined in the specifications table in drawing C200

Detail - The Contractor shall test a representative sample of the proposed granular aggregate to be used to determine the maximum dry density and optimum moisture content, standard compaction and the particle size distribution
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - NZS 4402: 1986 Test 4.1.1, NZS 4402: 1986 Test 2.8 .2
Detail - The test results shall be no older than 3 months so that they represent the actual proposed materials.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Check testing results are less than 3 months old
Detail - All material sampling and testing shall be completed by a suitably qualified laboratory and laboratory personnel
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - IANZ registered laboratory, laboratory certified to ISO 9001 or 9002
Detail - The geotextile filter fabric lining the excavation and wall, Examples of acceptable materials are 'Duraforce AS410' and 'Bidim A29' or similar approved equivalent.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - non-woven geotextile and meet the requirements of TNZ F/7:2003 for strength Class C and filtration Class 1
Detail - The geotextile's properties, testing, storage and installation shall comply with the requirements of Transit NZ
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review

Detail - The subsoil drainage pipe shall be smooth bored, perforated 110mm dia. HDPE or PE complying with NZS 7604:1981 and TNZ F/2:2000. The perforations shall be circular 6.5 mm (+1.5 mm) in diameter, arranged as shown in the Appendix 1 of TNZ F/2:2000, “Pipe Subsoil Drain Construction”.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Detail - Outlet and connecting pipes shall be unperforated.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, Visual Inspection
Detail - The drainage pipe shall be wrapped in a drainage blanket geo-composite, such as 'Filter sleeve' or equivalent approved.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Confirm drainage blanket before install

Detail - The timber lagging shall be placed against the back of the poles so that they fit closely to the poles and to the lagging board below. Only lightweight compaction to be used within 0.5 m of lagging with care to avoid lagging deformation.
○ All lagging joints shall be located against a pole. Lagging joints shall be staggered so that there is a continuous lagging board above and below each joint.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Confirm lagging is placed correctly, and no heavy compaction conducted within 0.5m
Detail - The lagging shall be held in place using screws. No boards with obvious defects shall be used e.g. severe warping, knots etc.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Confirm and document screw installation is correct and lagging timber is appropriate
Detail - Geotextile filter fabric shall be placed in the locations shown on the drawings. At joins the fabric shall be overlapped by a minimum of 200mm.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - At joins overlapped by a minimum of 200mm

Detail - The Contractor shall take care not to damage the fabric during installation. Any tears shall be repaired at the Contractors expense by placing additional fabric over the damaged area, with a 200mm overlap on all sides
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - tears shall be repaired by contractor, overlapped by a minimum of 200mm

Detail - The subsoil shall be placed as shown on the drawings. Outlets from the subsoil shall be constructed to discharge water clear of the site, onto stable ground, with sufficient fall across the length of the subsoil pipe to prevent silting.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Outlets from the subsoil shall be constructed to discharge water clear of the site
Detail - The location of the outlets shall be determined in conjunction with the Engineer on site
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection, Document review
Conformance Criteria - HOLD POINT: CPS engineer to review and approve location of outlets
Detail - The Contractor shall ensure that the method of placement and compaction permits safe labour about the excavation.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Temp works confirmation for excavation area, for placement and compaction
Detail - Lightweight compaction shall be undertaken within 1 m of the wall face, to prevent damaging wall components.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Not heavy compaction works within 1m

Detail - The backfill material shall be placed and compacted in layers of no more than 200mm loose depth. Each layer shall be compacted by hand operated mechanical plate compactors, heavy compaction may be used from 1 m behind the wall to aid compaction.
○ Care shall be taken to avoid striking or damaging the wall components with compaction equipment.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Compaction shall be no less than 95% of the Maximum Dry Density, heavy compaction may be used
Detail - 1m behind the wall compaction requirements vary from within 1m. But Care shall be taken to avoid striking or damaging the wall components with compaction equipment.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Compaction shall be no less than 95% of the Maximum Dry Density, heavy compaction may be used

Detail - At least 3 sets of at least 5 NDM tests shall be carried out, Back-fill shall be compacted in layers no greater than 200 mm loose 'lifts'. Clegg Hammer tests shall be conducted every second lift along the length of the wall.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - l 3 sets of at least 5 NDM tests
○ Carried out at approx. 1/3, 2/3 and finish level.
○ Results shall be forwarded to the Engineer within 24 hours of the tests being carried out
Records - site inspection, Photos, test results
Detail - All the surface water should be diverted away from the proposed retaining wall.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Subsurface designed on site in a way to ensure surface water is diverted away from the retaining wall.
Detail - Ensure all works comply with design prior to carrying on with next construction process
Frequency - At completion of sub soil drainage line
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Survey
Detail - Ensure all NCRs are closed and included within QA file, Delivery Dockets and Lab Testing Spreadsheet and Test Reports to be included in QA File
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all QA is uploaded into ConQA / Procore
Records - Delivery Dockets, Test Reports, Lab Testing Register
Detail - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - At the completion of the Lot of work
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Drawings
